item.title: 'Like Brain Boot Camp': Using Music To Ease Hearing Loss
item.description: May 31, 2017 - Researchers in Toronto are studying whether singing in a choir and practicing pitch can help hearing-impaired people function better in noisy environments.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 31, 2017 - Researchers in Toronto are studying whether singing in a choir and practicing pitch can help hearing-impaired people function better in noisy environments. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/31/530723021/like-brain-boot-camp-using-music-to-ease-hearing-loss

item.title: We Asked, You Answered: Does U.S. Foreign Aid Raise Living Standards?
item.description:
May 31, 2017 - Researchers are split on the issue. We asked our audience to weigh in.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/05/31/530227945/we-asked-you-answered-does-u-s-foreign-aid-raise-living-standards
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 31, 2017 - Researchers are split on the issue. We asked our audience to weigh in. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/05/31/530227945/we-asked-you-answered-does-u-s-foreign-aid-raise-living-standards

item.title: Medicare Advantage Insurers Settle Whistleblower Suit For $32 Million
item.description: May 31, 2017 - A former medical director at two Florida insurance companies alleged the companies inflated fees by making patients appear sicker than they were or exaggerating the treatment that was provided.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 31, 2017 - A former medical director at two Florida insurance companies alleged the companies inflated fees by making patients appear sicker than they were or exaggerating the treatment that was provided. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/31/530868367/medicare-advantage-insurers-settle-whistleblower-suit-for-32-million

item.title: Poll: Americans Increasingly Think Their Health Care Will Get Worse
item.description: May 31, 2017 - A survey by the Kaiser Family Foundation found that about half of adults now have a favorable view of the Affordable Care Act, or Obamacare, while one-third prefer the Republican alternative.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 31, 2017 - A survey by the Kaiser Family Foundation found that about half of adults now have a favorable view of the Affordable Care Act, or Obamacare, while one-third prefer the Republican alternative. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/31/530843602/poll-americans-increasingly-think-their-health-care-will-get-worse

item.title: New Rules May Make Online Health Insurance Sales Simpler
item.description: May 31, 2017 - A rules change lets insurers and brokers sell health coverage on the federal exchange directly. That should be easier, but also raises questions about whether customers get unbiased information.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 31, 2017 - A rules change lets insurers and brokers sell health coverage on the federal exchange directly. That should be easier, but also raises questions about whether customers get unbiased information. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/31/530724704/new-rules-may-make-online-health-insurance-sales-simpler

item.title: 13 Reasons Why Not: Michigan Teens Talk Honestly About Suicide
item.description: May 30, 2017 - The popular Netflix show 13 Reasons Why is about a teen who commits suicide. Youth Radio brings us the story of one Michigan high school's project called 13 Reasons Why Not. It features 13 stories of students overcoming their struggles.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 30, 2017 - The popular Netflix show 13 Reasons Why is about a teen who commits suicide. Youth Radio brings us the story of one Michigan high school's project called 13 Reasons Why Not. It features 13 stories of students overcoming their struggles. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/30/530769850/13-reasons-why-not-michigan-teens-talk-honestly-about-suicide

item.title: Powerful New Ebola Vaccine Heads To Congo To Help Stop Outbreak
item.description: May 30, 2017 - The Democratic Republic of Congo has been fighting a small Ebola outbreak since April. Now its government has given the green light to use a new Ebola vaccine.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 30, 2017 - The Democratic Republic of Congo has been fighting a small Ebola outbreak since April. Now its government has given the green light to use a new Ebola vaccine. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/05/30/530742469/powerful-new-ebola-vaccine-heads-to-congo-to-help-stop-outbreak

item.title: Are State Rules For Treating Sepsis Really Saving Lives?
item.description: May 30, 2017 - Some states dictate how doctors must treat this life-threatening reaction to infection, and early intervention is helping. But scientific evidence may be changing too rapidly for the rules to keep up.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 30, 2017 - Some states dictate how doctors must treat this life-threatening reaction to infection, and early intervention is helping. But scientific evidence may be changing too rapidly for the rules to keep up. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/30/530224517/are-state-rules-for-treating-sepsis-really-saving-lives

item.title: States Fear Price Of New Zika Vaccine Will Be More Than They Can Pay
item.description: May 30, 2017 - The vaccine against Zika vaccine was developed by the Army, with the government paying for clinical trials, too. Health officials want to be sure drugmaker Sanofi Pasteur doesn't make it unaffordable.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 30, 2017 - The vaccine against Zika vaccine was developed by the Army, with the government paying for clinical trials, too. Health officials want to be sure drugmaker Sanofi Pasteur doesn't make it unaffordable. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/30/529887446/states-fear-price-of-new-zika-vaccine-will-be-more-than-they-can-pay

item.title: News Brief: Texas Legislative Term Ends, Trial Begins In Minn. Police Shooting
item.description: May 30, 2017 - Texas politicians accused each other of making threats. In Minnesota, jury selection is to begin Tuesday in the trial of a police officer charged with killing a driver during a controversial shooting.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 30, 2017 - Texas politicians accused each other of making threats. In Minnesota, jury selection is to begin Tuesday in the trial of a police officer charged with killing a driver during a controversial shooting. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/30/530677885/news-brief-texas-legislative-term-ends-trial-begins-in-minn-police-shooting

item.title: Cash-Strapped Seniors Turn To Assisted Living Centers In Mexico
item.description: May 29, 2017 - Some seniors are moving to Mexico for assisted living care. Costs at these facilities are much cheaper, but family members worry about the distance and their loved one's access to medical care.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 29, 2017 - Some seniors are moving to Mexico for assisted living care. Costs at these facilities are much cheaper, but family members worry about the distance and their loved one's access to medical care. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/29/530617223/cash-strapped-seniors-turn-to-assisted-living-centers-in-mexico

item.title: Watch Women Shame Men Who Pee In Public
item.description: May 29, 2017 - The idea behind this viral ad is to convince men how important it is to have a toilet in the house. That's a major issue in India, where more than 500 million people are loo-less.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 29, 2017 - The idea behind this viral ad is to convince men how important it is to have a toilet in the house. That's a major issue in India, where more than 500 million people are loo-less. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/05/29/530244262/watch-women-shame-men-who-pee-in-public

item.title: Handshake-Free Zones Target Spread Of Germs In The Hospital
item.description: May 29, 2017 - Hospital-acquired infections can be life-threatening, and unwashed hands are often to blame. One hospital in California thinks banishing handshakes could help reduce infections.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 29, 2017 - Hospital-acquired infections can be life-threatening, and unwashed hands are often to blame. One hospital in California thinks banishing handshakes could help reduce infections. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/29/529878742/handshake-free-zones-target-spread-of-germs-in-the-hospital

item.title: Adult ADHD Can't Be Diagnosed With A Simple Screening Test, Doctors Warn
item.description: May 29, 2017 - Despite support from the World Health Organization for the latest adult ADHD screening survey, some researchers worry that it will lead to over-prescribing of powerful amphetamines.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 29, 2017 - Despite support from the World Health Organization for the latest adult ADHD screening survey, some researchers worry that it will lead to over-prescribing of powerful amphetamines. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/29/527654633/adult-adhd-cant-be-diagnosed-with-a-simple-screening-test-doctors-warn

item.title: From NFL Player To Neurosurgeon: 'Why Can't I Do Both?'
item.description: May 28, 2017 - Myron Rolle talks about his long journey from playing football at Florida State University and joining the NFL to going to Harvard medical school to start his residency in neurosurgery.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 28, 2017 - Myron Rolle talks about his long journey from playing football at Florida State University and joining the NFL to going to Harvard medical school to start his residency in neurosurgery. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/28/530504767/from-nfl-player-to-neurosurgeon-why-cant-i-do-both
